Description: Body sherd of Ionian pottery stemmed plate; reddish fabric. Inside: central floral motif surrounded by two bands; around, flower and bud frieze. Underside, two bands and paint around top of stem.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: van de Wiel 1968 / Verzameling ceramiek en Terracotta's Archaeologisch Instituut der Rijksuniversiteit Leiden (p. 4, N 11)
Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 41, no. C. 1e)
CVA Musée Scheurleer II (Hague) / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Pays-Bas Musée Scheurleer (II D, p. 5, pl. II, no. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.770)
